content.question: The graph above shows the changes in temperature recorded for the <math alttext="2.00 liters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> surrounding a constant-volume container in which a <math alttext="1.00 gram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>1.00</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of benzoic acid was combusted. Assume that heat was not absorbed by the container or lost to the surroundings, that the density of <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="1.00 gram per milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g/mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and that the specific heat capacity of <math alttext="H 2 O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is about <math alttext="4.2 joules per gram per degree Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J/g</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on this information, estimate how much heat was released from the combustion of the benzoic acid sample.

skill.text: 2.D: Make observations or collect data from representations of laboratory setups or results, while attending to precision where appropriate.
